Games.Name: A Tale of Vengeance
Games.Overview: One of the best OpenBOR games around, very fun and very complete feel. There are 10 levels, 13 boss battles, great sound track, and even 3 secret characters!

Games.Name: Art of Fighting: Beats of Rage Remix III
Art of Figting: Trouble In South Town
Asterix & Caesar's Challenge
Games.Overview: You accompany Astérix and Obélix in their adventures. The game is set up like the old school Batman Returns, or King of Dragons. You have an energy bar. Use your energy to perform two different attacks and beat the Roman army.

Games.Name: Avengers: United Battle Force
Games.Overview:
Avengers: United Battle Force is a remix of the old Captain America and the Avengers arcade game, adding new characters and a host of upgrades. This 2-player beat 'em up was created by Douglas Baldan using the OpenBor engine and was released in 2013.

Features:
• 17 playable characters plus unlockable ones
• 20 supporting characters
• 3 chapters with more than 15 stages
• Many special powers, including devastating Hyper Moves
• Alternative route
• Alternative mode for some characters
• Bonus stages and aerial stages
• Intense fights with more than 10 bosses
• Many items and traps
• Custom voiced characters
• Custom loading screens
• Music tempo changes based on the health of the boss

Games.Name: Bare Knuckle III: Yesterday Once More
Battletoads & Double Dragon III: The T.Bird Mission
Battletoads & Double Dragon IV: The Return of the Dark Forces
Games.Overview: Battletoads Double Dragon IV: Return of The Dark Forces is a street fighting game, based on the Battletoads sagas from Tradewest and Double Dragon from Technos. The Toads from Battletoads and the brothers Billy and Jimmy from Double Dragon have returned, and once again they must hit the streets beating everyone who gets in their way. This time the characters of both games decide to meet to find out who is behind some explosions that affected the city and innocent people who had to flee their homes in search of refuge. During this period, enemies began to appear everywhere, turning the city into complete chaos. This is where frogs and humans unite to defend the population, using all their abilities and special moves to destroy this new threat.

Games.Name: Battletoads Double Dragon: The Revenge
Games.Overview:
Battletoads Double Dragon: The Revenge is a fan-made sequel to the 16-bit console hit from 1993, created using the OpenBOR engine and released in 2019 by MadGear.

Features:
• Choose from 5 playable characters: Rash, Zitz, Pimple, Billy, & Jimmy
• Play solo and save Marian alone or play simultaneously for classic 2-player co-op action
• Follow the story as you go through 8 missions
• 3 vehicle stages to crank up the action
• 4 extra bonus modes selectable from the start
• Detailed old-school cutscenes between missions
• Lots of different moves to crush your enemies with
• Familiair enemies and bosses from both the Battletoads and Double Dragon series
• Soundtrack consisting of songs from various Battletoads and Double Dragon games
• And many other features!

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Battletoads & Double Dragon II: The Revenge

Games.Name: Beats of Rage
Games.Overview:
Beats of Rage is an open source brawler fighting game engine. The default game included with the engine is also called of Beats of Rage and it it a 2D brawler inspired by the Street of Rage series. Players go through different levels in a city controlled by a criminal syndicate led by a Mr. Y. But three young friends, Kula Gem, Max Bacon and Mandy Bluegard can stop him.

The character sprites and some background art are taken from the King of Fighters games. Controls consists of four movement and three action keys. The player fights regular enemies and bosses. Some levels feature death drops where the player must avoid falling off, but can throw enemies into that void.

Games.Name: Beats of Rage Remix: Rhythm of Destruction
Beats of Rage: Alliance Super Sayan
Bruce Lee: Revenge of the Dragon
Contra: Locked 'N' Loaded
Games.Overview:
Contra: Locked 'N' Loaded is a run-n-gun shooter developed as an attempt to remake the original Konami classic, Contra, using the OpenBOR engine. It features more playable characters and 3 missions, with two additional stages that can be unlocked upon completion. Some improvements include the ability to slide, shoot in 8 directions and carry two weapons.

Features:
• 12 different weapons
• Health bar which gives 3 hit points for player
• Health items
• Motorbike mode
• Lots of variety in the horizontal and vertical level design
• Challenging bosses and sub-bosses
• Save game enabled for all missions but Boss Rush

Games.Name: Darkstalkers
Games.Overview: A fanmade OpenBor version of the CAPCOM arcade classic.

Games.Name: Double Dragon Reloaded: Alternate Edition
Games.Overview:
Double Dragon Reloaded: Alternate is a mix of the first two games in the Double Dragon saga, created with the OpenBOR project and released in 2017. It includes a roster of new characters along with old favorites, including wrestling legends like Hulk Hogan.

Up to two players can play together and the gameplay stays true to its predecessors with punch & kick attacks, grabs, weapons, and more. There are five game modes of beat 'em up fun, for example, a stage where you hunt down Andre the Giant after he destroys your motorcycle. The game takes all of the best elements from the arcade classics while staying true to their spirit.

Games.Name: Dragon Ball
Games.Overview: Inspired in the game of GBA

Games.Name: Dragon Ball Z: Attack of the Saiyans
Games.Overview: Dragon Ball Z: Attack of the Saiyans is an OpenBOR beat 'em up released in 2017. The game tells the story of Goku's father, Bardock, and of the final days in the life of planet Vegeta. With sharp graphics and cutscenes, fast gameplay and responsive controls, the game is a well-polished entry into the OpenBOR library.

Games.Name: Dreams of Rage
Games.Overview: The man of your dreams is back and this time in, full on, 16-bit glory. Fight through an army of Freddy's past victims, hellish nightmares, and Krueger himself as one of the Dream Warriors. Do you have what it takes?

Games.Name: Dungeons & Dragons: Rise of Warduke
Games.Overview:
A new enemy has summoned evil and killed all of the heroes! Discover the world of Greyhawk and stop Iuz's campaign to conquer the Kingdom of Furyondy! Undertake daring missions to rescue allies, sabotage enemy strongholds and find the secret to defeating this threat once and for all!

Created by Counte Monte on the OpenBOR engine, Dungeons and Dragons: The Rise of Warduke is not just a button-mashing beat 'em up but mixes in a bit of role-playing adventure as you visit towns across the map, talk to NPC's and fight random encounters. There are 13 playable characters, some of whom must be unlocked like dark elves and necromancers, who can learn dozens of spells, buy weapons and equipment, complete quests, hire mercanaries, solve puzzles and traps, find secret dungeons, joust for prizes, and much more!

Games.Name: Eternal Champions: The Thin Strings of Fate
Games.Overview:
The game features a campaign starring Shadow Yamoto, one of the protagonists of Eternal Champions. It has several different features including: 

* Alternative secret paths
* 4 endings in the main campaign
* 3 endings for extra modes
* 3 unlockable modes
* 5 unlockable characters

The game also features a rudimentary level up system, allowing the player to gain HP and MP, along with learning new combos and special skills.

Games.Name: Final Fight LNS Ultimate
Games.Overview: Final Fight LNS Ultimate is a beat'em up that mixes concepts and movements from both the beat'em up and the fighting genre. It has a revolutionary and innovative warping system based on "canceling", which allows us to link special movements within others, thus making a very high number of blows. The game is also designed so that its difficulty decreases considerably as we learn and execute this system, so the learning curve is steep. In other words, the game will reward us as we learn to inflict maximum damage on targets.

Games.Name: Final Fight X
Games.Overview: Final Fight X is probably the most conservative of Final Fight versions of OpenBOR, being much more faithful to Capcom's original work, so much so that we could almost consider it as the real Final Fight 2 instead of the game that was released for Super Nintendo. In Final Fight X you are able to choose between the three protagonists that appeared in the original game (Haggar, Guy and Cody) to overcome the different stages, in which they will face against all the enemies that appeared in the original title. Both graphically and playability the game is a carbon copy of the original arcade, but with completely new stages.

Games.Name: G.I. Joe: Attack on Cobra Island
Games.Overview:
Battle your way over land, sea and air down into the depths of Cobra Island, in attempt to stop a doomsday missile from being launched by Cobra Commander! 

G.I. Joe: Attack on Cobra Island is an OpenBOR beat 'em up starring everyone's favorite Joes, such as Snake Eyes, Duke, and unlockables like Hawk and Sgt. Slaughter, with several missions, updated sprites, new enemies and more!

AlternateNames.AlternateName: G.I. Joe Attack on Cobra Island

Games.Name: Golden Axe Genesis
Games.Overview: Golden Axe Genesis is a fan-made sequel to the arcade beat 'em ups from the 90's, featuring new enemies, graphics, faster gameplay and an overhaul to the balance and design. Developed by SEEP, a two-man team of brothers from Italy, it was made using the OpenBOR engine and offers 13 playable heroes and numerous villains to battle from the franchise's saga. There's a Story mode and a survival mini-game called Duel mode, as well as the ability to play the arcade original with the new characters and updates.

Games.Name: Golden Axe Legend
Games.Overview:
THE ULTIMATE GOLDEN AXE REMAKE!

* The original story revisited!
* 7 characters from Golden Axe 1, 2 and 3 to choose from!
* All characters have long/short range combos and custom throws, plus they can run, block, counter, and perform astonishing Special Moves!
* Fill your magic meter and unleash the ultimate magic!
* Find and ride the 4 different bizarrians, each with his own attack!
* Enemies and bosses from Golden Axe 1, 2 and 3! Plus some surprises!
* Choose your destiny, with multiple paths available! Will you find the path leading to the TRUE final battle?
* Survival and training modes, where you can fight hordes of enemies and train your moves!

Games.Name: Golden Axe Myth
Games.Overview:
Developed by a small team of fans from Argentina, Golden Axe Myth is a spiritual successor to Sega's 1989 arcade classic, Golden Axe, and runs on the open-source Beats of Rage engine, the foundation of many homebrew beat 'em ups.

Fight your way through 16 different locations and choose from 4 main fighters -- barbarian Ax Battler, amazon Tyris Flare, dwarf Gilius Thunderhead, and Death Adder, the game's original villain -- with bonus characters who can join the party in later stages. All heroes have different strengths and weaknesses and you can pick up and play from where you left off with another character, should you die.

Brief cutscenes tell the story with branching paths and hidden areas along the way. In addition to magic jars, grab power-ups to increase your strength and defense, and money to buy items in the shops. The mechanics have been expanded to allow vertical rolls, blocking and additional special movies like Rage Mode.

The game was one of the first OpenBOR projects to feature totally original art and was widely praised for its production and overall fun factor.

Games.Name: He-Man and the Masters of the Universe
Games.Overview:
He-Man and the Masters of the Universe is a side-scrolling brawler featuring He-Man, She-Ra and pals battling their way through Eternia to defeat the evil Hordak. Created in the OpenBOR engine, up to four players hack and slash through 28 levels of arcade fun based on the classic 80's cartoon.

Hordak has invaded Eternia, banished Skeletor and Evil-Lyn from Snake Mountain, and plans to steal the Diamonds of Power. To stop him, choose from a sizeable roster of playable characters, like Man-at-Arms, Orko, Sorceress, Teela, Skeletor, Evil-Lyn, Ram-Man, or even the Thundercats' Lion-O. Each character has their own special moves like flying or summoning the big cats, BattleCat and Panthor.

There's a Story mode and Versus mode, with a nice variety to the level design, mixing in platforming and shooter stages with ally protection, mazes and time-limited gameplay. Along the way, the heroes will encounter boss fights against some of the most memorable villains from the series, including fan favorites Beast Man, Mer-Man and Trap Jaw, among many others.

Games.Name: Justice League Legacy
Games.Overview: Justice League Legacy is a 2D beat 'em up and the ultimate update to Justice League United, according to creator ZVitor, one of the most prolific OpenBOR developers. It was released October 2020 and features 47 characters, a DC saga-spanning story mode, a bonus mode and lots of extra content.

Games.Name: Justice League United
Games.Overview:
Justice League United is an awesome old school side scrolling arcade beat ‘em up that sees Batman, Wonder Woman and their super pals teaming up against DC’s deadliest super villains.

Justice League United is a fantastic fan made project created in the OpenBOR engine that delivers a fun blend of shoot ‘em up and beat ‘em up Justice League arcade action. It features local co-op play across seven large stages with seven playable characters and lots of supervillains to beat up.

Gameplay is split up into three distinct styles of game modes – 2D side scrolling beat ‘em up action akin to the Batman and Robocop arcade games, Streets of Rage style 2.5D beat ‘em up action and side scrolling shoot em up sections with vehicles. It’s a nice mixture of game styles that adds a nice bit of variety and stops the gameplay from becoming too stale.

You can choose to play as Superman, Batman, Aquaman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern, Cyborg and Flash. Each level of the game is based on the story and setting of each character, and all the characters have their strengths and own selection of cool special moves. It’s a pretty tough game with some challenging boss fights and you only have a finite number of continues so you will need to use a bit of skill to make it to the end.

Justice League United really impresses with its high level of polish, fan service, quality of character animation, variety of gameplay and old school side scrolling arcade action.

Games.Name: Kill Bill
Games.Overview:
It's the Bride's mission to cross Oren-Ishi off her revenge list after being left for dead on her wedding day, in this side-scrolling beat 'em up based on the hit film by Quentin Tarantino.

First created by the Senile Team in 2004, this old OpenBOR remake by Thatcher Productions adds extensive animations and fixed level designs, as well as new enemy A.I., character moves and other enhancements.

Games.Name: Knights & Dragons: The Endless Quest
Games.Overview:
Start an epic journey in a land full of mystery and adventure! Explore the realm of Karameikos, complete the quests scattered across the map, find new friends that will join in your travels, and unveil the mistery under the monsters' invasion!

• New & improved level-up system! as you level up, you will gain healt points, magic points and new exciting special moves for all the characters!
• New game modes! unlock the Endless Quest with all the characters aviable from the start! or put yourself to test with the new Arcade Quests, where you start at level 20 from the beginning, and face all the quests without break, in a classic arcade battle that will leave you breathless!
• New block system! now you have an appropiate button to defend yourself!
• New recover system! when knocked down, press the jump button and the directional controls repeatedly to stand up immediately and crush your enemies!
• up to 4 players can play together! Can you survive in this perilious lands by yourself, or you'll face the threats with your trusted fellowship?
• tons of treasures, monsters and DRAGONS!

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Dungeons & Dragons: Knights & Dragons: The Endless Quest

Games.Name: Marvel First Alliance
Games.Overview:
Avengers assemble! In 2013, developer ZVitor launched Marvel First Alliance, a beat 'em up created with the OpenBor engine and inspired by classics like Streets of Rage and Double Dragon. It features a Marvel dream team and includes simultaneous four-player action for friends to join in!

The Story begins with the threat of the malefic organization Hydra, choosing your hero from favorites such as Hulk, Captain America or Thor, among others. More superheroes are unlocked with the defeat of enemy bosses, including Wolverine, Storm, Spiderman, Colossus, Iron Man, Nightcrawler, Cyclops and many more! Each character is not just aesthetically different and faithful to the comic sources; they also have different movement types, speed and special attacks. The traditional side-scrolling gameplay throws lots of enemies at the player until reaching the final boss of each level and the large and diverse cast offers some variety and replayability.

The game's long development shows in its attention to detail and became a stepping stone for the Brazilian developer, being among the first of many OpenBor releases. A follow-up to this game, Marvel First Alliance 2, was more of an update rather than a sequel, adding more characters, tweaks and fixes to the original.

Games.Name: Marvel First Alliance 2
Games.Overview:
Red Skull and Hydra are trying to take over the world! Grab up to four players and team up as one of dozens of Marvel's most powerful superheroes to stop them, in Marvel First Alliance 2. 

This 16-bit beat 'em up was released in 2014 by ZVitor, a popular designer from Brazil who created the game using the OpenBor engine project. It features dozens of playable characters that are unlocked after each level in the Story mode. Finish the game and unlock numerous other modes, like a Spider-Man and Carnage scenario, X-Men and Apocalypse, or harder difficulties. The game plays like the traditional side-scrolling brawlers from the arcades with unique special abilities and power-ups, and adds some modern updates to the mix, like NPC-controlled heroes joining you during the fight and situation-specific characters available according to the story.

Games.Name: Marvel Infinity War
Games.Overview:
Marvel Infinity War is a fan-made game using the OpenBor engine. This beat 'em up harkens back to the  arcades of old with 85 playable good guys and bad guys from the Marvel universe. Using a six-button control scheme, each character has a special move and an ultra move, along with special assist characters to summon during the heat of battle.

There are five different overarching teams of characters available, including the Avengers, X-Men, Cosmic, Street Level, and Villains. They each visit their own stages and battle different bosses.

Games.Name: Mass Effect: Dark Corners of the Galaxy
Maximum Carnage Returns
Games.Overview: Maximum Carnage Returns is an OpenBOR beat 'em up created by Silas Elrick Heat and Heat Games in 2017. This fan-made reboot of the 16-bit classic from 1994, Maximum Carnage, features three playable characters: Spider-Man, Deadpool and Venom.

Games.Name: Megaman: War of the Past
Games.Overview: Megaman: War of the Past has the unique distinction of being the first fully completed Beats of Rage mod. Created by DCSteve in 2004, the mod displayed many features which would lead the way for even more enhancements to the original game module. The mod also influenced the further development of the Beats of Rage game engine, which eventually became OpenBoR.

Games.Name: Mortal Kombat Defenders of The Realm
Games.Overview: Mortal Kombat classic games, reimagined like a 16bits beatn up.

Games.Name: Mortal Kombat: Outworld Assassins
Games.Overview:
Mortal Kombat: Outworld Assassins is a 2D beat 'em up developed by Magggas and modded by Gurtag using the OpenBOR engine. It was originally released in 2010 and updated eight years later.

Play solo or co-op as Sub-Zero, Scorpion or Noob Saibot and fight off countless enemies from Mortal Kombat lore using a lethal array of attacks and special moves, complete with the blood and guts the franchise is known for. Gameplay is fast and the controls are tight, responsive and so satisfying to send limbs flying and finish off foes with a decapitation.

On March 21, 2018, Magggas released a widescreen version of the game that includes bug fixes and minor tweaks to the original, known as Mortal Kombat: Outworld Assassins XL.

Games.Name: Neon Lightning Force
Games.Overview:
The year is 2044. After the events of World War I, the United States and the European Union no longer exist, were completely devastated by the nuclear invasion. The vacuum of power in North America gave rise to the “Union of the Pacific”, with Neopolis as the capital in South America.

While the world is still at peace, Neopolis police still fight crime in the city, even as they are getting more violent by the day.

They send the special agent, Isolde Shinwara, to investigate those cases that found traces of Drako, a drug that makes the person stronger and more aggressive. During the journey, Isolde will find that this will lead to a much more dangerous and corrupt path originally conceived...

Games.Name: Night Slashers X
Games.Overview:
Night Slashers X is a fan-made beat 'em up based on the Data East arcade classic Night Slashers, which sees four playable monster hunters fighting their way through hordes of the undead.

Created in OpenBOR, the game features upgraded visuals, a widescreen mode and more enemies. The three original playable characters are present, each with their own unique move-sets, and now they’re joined by Ash from The Evil Dead. Ash can’t pick up and use weapons but he keeps the monsters at bay with his deadly boomstick and trademark arm-mounted chainsaw!

With only 2 continues per playthrough, Night Slashers X is a tough game. Play with up to four players to aid your chances in this pixel-perfect retro throwback!

Games.Name: Power Rangers: Beats of Power
Games.Overview:
Power Rangers: Beats of Power is a freeware fan-made indie developed arcade beat 'em up game created by Merso X Games on GameJolt. It was released online in 2014 and is available for Mac or PC.

The game is designed as a retro throwback to classic 1990s Power Rangers games such as the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers games for the SNES and the Genesis and Power Rangers: The Fighting Edition. In March of 2017, the game was updated with a Special Edition version released. 

The game benefits greatly from the energetic tunes of the TV show. Also included are numerous voice clips and sound effects taken from the show.

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Power Rangers: Beats of Power - Special Edition

Games.Name: Retro Gamer Adventure
Games.Overview: Retro Gamer Adventure is an OpenBOR beat 'em up released in 2019 by Brazilian creator ZVitor. Similar in style to River City Ransom, it features 15 real-life playable characters from YouTube's gaming community with fully-voiced story sequences in Portuguese. Each character has a special move and costume set that takes inspiration from comics and videogame culture. For example, ZVitor himself is playable and has the ability to blast enemies with an infinity stone gauntlet on his hand, donning an Aquaman suit when his power-up meter fills up. The game has great graphics and charming level design, with lots of fun characters to brawl with and against.

Games.Name: Samurai Warriors
Games.Overview: A 2D adventure beat'em up game. Play as Oda Nobunaga, the main antagonist of the Sengoku Basara serie. In the anime, Oda Nobunaga serves as the primary antagonist as he was responsible for occurring the events throughout the story. He often called himself "The Demon King of the Sixth Heaven" and he always says based on his motto: "To take the world by force", though it became clear that he would rule the world with fear and total tyranny of darkness, according to Shingen Takeda.

Games.Name: Sega Brawlers Megamix
Games.Overview: Sega Brawlers Megamix brings together many of Sega's characters into one big beat 'em up! Created in OpenBOR, it features a roster of about 60 heroes from Sonic, Streets of Rage, Golden Axe, Guardian Heroes, and more. Special guest cameos include Earthworm Jim, the Battletoads, Rick Taylor from Splatterhouse, and lots of others!

Games.Name: Silver Night's Crusaders
Games.Overview:
Corruption, religious impiety and the unscrupulous selling of indulgences strengthened the Protestant Reformers who, denouncing the morality of the Roman Catholic Church, founded their own organizations to combat the growing dark forces. Witchcraft and vampire hunting are among the many unorthodox activities strongly condemned and persecuted by the church.

At the beginning of the 17th century, reports emerged from the small hungarian village of Čachtice regarding the disappearance of several young women, as well as the increasing presence of horrendous nocturnal creatures in the region.

The church dismissed these claims until the victims included the young daughters of aristocrats and landowners close to the Countess Elizabeth Bathory, who owns a large castle in Čachtice. Reports also mentioned the existence of an ancient pagan relic recently acquired by the Countess.

Taking matters into their own hands, the church dispatched two of his paladins to pay a visit to the countess and investigate that mysterious relic...

Games.Name: Streets of Rage Zombies
Games.Overview: It's Streets of Rage with zombies! This bloody beat 'em up was created as an OpenBOR project and released in 2017 on ChronoCrash.com. Play as one of six Streets of Rage fighters, including a zombie, and smash your way through hordes of disgustingly awesome mutilated corpses of the undead. With great sprite-based graphics and fast and fluid brawler gameplay, creator suhmai adds a worthy entry into the homebrew OpenBOR database.

Games.Name: Streets of Rage: Silent Hill
Games.Overview:
Streets of Rage: Silent Hill, a beat'em up developed by OpenBor, takes the classic Streets of Rage and mixes it with environments and characters from the Silent Hill franchise. You'll be able to play as characters from both Silent Hill 1 and 2 (for example, the villain Pyramid Head).

The gameplay is typical for this genre: you'll walk down the streets of Silent Hill fighting dozens of enemies that will come at you from all angles. Although you'll find objects that heal you, you won't be able to use any weapons.

The detailed graphics in Streets of Rage: Silent Hill are excellent. Some elements are taken straight from other OpenBor games while others are original and have their own great style. The animations of dead bodies fit perfectly with the game's environment.

Streets of Rage: Silent Hill is a very fun action game that contains enough elements to satisfy both Silent Hill and Streets of Rage fans.

Games.Name: Super Karate Kid
Games.Overview:
Super Karate Kid is a fan-made remake of the 1987 game for the NES, developed by Merso X using the OpenBOR engine.

Differences include:

• Updated graphics and sound
• Background and foreground are easier to distinguish from each other
• Updated controls: designated buttons for jumping and special attacks
• Short invincibility period after getting hit avoids getting sandwiched between two enemies
• New intro and ending sequences
• Features appearance by arch nemesis Johnny Lawrence

Games.Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Red Sky Battle
Games.Overview: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Red Sky Battle is a scrolling fighting game dedicated to the Ninja Turtles. It features 16-bit cartoon graphics with fluid animations and gameplay very similar to "Turtles in Time", the famous fighting game made by Konami in the 90s.

Games.Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Rescue-Palooza!
Games.Overview: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Rescue-Palooza is a fan-made beat 'em up using OpenBOR and created as an update and homage to the classic NES titles. It includes 4-player local co-op with 60 playable characters, more than 20 stages and bonus levels, as well as rideable vehicles. It also features improved graphics, voice clips from the cartoon show and countless references to the toyline, comics and culture. Cowabunga!

Games.Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shell Shocked
Games.Overview: A tribute to 90's arcade brawlers, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shell Shocked was created with the OpenBOR engine by White Dragon Software and released in 2014. Play solo or co-op with up to 4 players, and choose from 11 characters to fight with, including the four ninja heroes and even villains like Bebop, Rocksteady and Foot Clan soldiers. There's nearly a dozen stages to fight through with well-crafted cutscenes to advance the story. Overall, the game plays just like the 1989 arcade original, adding a few more special moves and upgrades for a great, new adventure.

Games.Name: The Simpsons: Treehouse of Horror
Games.Overview:
Paying homage to the classic beat 'em up in the arcades, The Simpsons: Treehouse of Horror stars Homer, Bart and Krusty as they try to stop an alien invasion from taking over the Earth. The game plays just like the original arcade version, featuring lots of characters and bosses -- including Futurama and Family Guy cameos -- as well as exciting levels, cool weapons, and vehicles to drive!

Includes Bonus Games!
 - Reclaim Burns Manor: Play as Vampire Mr. Burns and stop the criminals from looting your mansion
 - Tournament mode: Face enemies in one-on-one combat
 - Family Guy: You are Peter and see the events that unfold before he and his family are teleported to Springfield

Games.Name: World Heroes Supreme Justice Extra
Games.Overview:
Evil is on the rise and it's up to the World Heroes to save the day! World Heroes Supreme Justice Extra is a widescreen update to the Neo Geo arcade original from 1992. It was created by Magggas using the OpenBor engine in 2013 and officially completed five years later.

This remake features 11 fighters, including 6 new ones: Muscle, J. Max, Janne, Gokuu, Kisarah, and C. Kidd. Along with fast and fluid controls, each character can pull off serial combos and unique super moves. Beat 'em up and smash your way across the stages to find health, money and weapons, with a tough boss waiting at the end. With great gameplay and HD visuals, it's a perfect example of a classic made modern.
